channel.title: New Half-Life 2: Episode 3 Concept Art?
channel.description: [url='https://www.valvetime.net/threads/exclusive-half-life-2-episode-3-concept-art.206815/']Source[/url] [quote] The images are from circa 2008 and therefore not necessarily representative of the current state of the project, but it's great to see new media, nonetheless. [/quote]

item.title: New Half-Life 2: Episode 3 Concept Art?
item.dc:creator: DiePoente
item.description:
I’d replace the main enemys in Half Life 3/Episode 3 with the real combine, the fat maggots called Advisors.

Read full topic

item.title: New Half-Life 2: Episode 3 Concept Art?
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Valve has stated that the next Half-Life release will not be the end of the adventures of Dr. Gordon Freeman. I see Half-Life as a typical 3-act story structure. As such, there are three components:

Half-Life 1-- Main enemy are Xenians, setting up the story universe and introducing the main characters
Half-Life 2-- Main enemy are the Combine, the conflict portion of the story. Half-Life 2: Episode 3 will probably wrap up the Combine’s story arc, leading to:
Half-Life 3-- Main enemy are the G-man’s eeeehhhhhmployers. In my speculation, once the story arc of Half-Life 3 is over, so are Gordon’s adventures. They’ll wrap everything up and Gordon will be the savior of at least the Earth if not the vort’s homeworld and possibly even the Combine’s homeworld.

But that’s all my speculation.

Read full topic

item.title: New Half-Life 2: Episode 3 Concept Art?
item.dc:creator: Kaweebo
item.description:
I’m content with whatever Valve decides to do, provided it doesn’t totally suck. If it’s done right, I won’t think twice about Gordon living or dying.

item.title: New Half-Life 2: Episode 3 Concept Art?

item.description:
DL: We haven’t announced anything specific, but Half-Life won’t end at Episode Three – hang on to your crowbars!

Not to mention how Gabe managed to work the phrase “the ongoing adventures of Gordon Freeman” into the commentary of both Episode 1 & 2.

item.title: New Half-Life 2: Episode 3 Concept Art?
item.dc:creator: M-Man
item.description:
I don’t WANT Gordon to die. I was just saying I’m not totally against the self sacrifice cliche.

Kairouseki:

Isn’t this next game supposed to tie up Gordon’s story?

Don’t quote me on this but I feel as if i’ve read an interview where someone from valve said that they planned to make more than just 3. But I’m not sure.

Loved your walking dead analogy Orpheon.

Read full topic

item.title: New Half-Life 2: Episode 3 Concept Art?
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
I dunno, I’ve always felt that the hero always surviving despite impossible odds is kind of a Hollywood cliche also (but I like it better than the heroic sacrifice). That said, after everything Gordon has already been through, what really COULD kill him? Besides, a hero’s death works best when you actually KNOW what the character was like. Take Boromir’s death in Fellowship of the Ring, for instance. Would it have been nearly as powerful if he hadn’t been struggling with his desire for power? But with Gordon, he’s silent, so you have no idea if he’s doing what he’s doing because he’s a courageous hero, or just because he intends to survive no matter what. It’s up to the player really. And in the end, if you die, it may or may not feel right depending on how you viewed Gordon.

Say you felt Gordon was a survive-at-all-costs-a-la-Shane-Walsh character. If the game forces you to sacrifice yourself to save others, you have no choice but to accept that Gordon had a last-minute change of heart and decided to do the right thing, even if you’d rather that he continue to be selfish. Now if you viewed Gordon as a no-man-left-behind-a-la-Rick-Grimes character, to sacrifice himself may be in his character. But you also might feel that after everything he already did, it was unfair to kill him off. Now imagine Gordon survives. There is no conflict, and everyone can have their own version of Gordon and be happy. Everyone wins. Valve would be stupid to not realize that killing off Gordon is a bad idea.

Read full topic

item.title: New Half-Life 2: Episode 3 Concept Art?
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
M-Man:

Personally I think that if Gordon gave up his life to save all of Earth or to finally stop Gman then it would be a noble and honorable way to die. Someone sacrificing their life doesn’t have to be a sad ending.

:retard:

Personally I think that if Gordon gave up his life to save all of Earth or to finally stop Gman then it would be a noble and honorable way to die.

item.title: New Half-Life 2: Episode 3 Concept Art?
item.dc:creator: MRPolo
item.description:
Pffft… You guys are stupid, don’t you know who is going to become the next leader of resistance? Can’t you smell the paranoia in the air? The stench of being stuck in another world for years? You seriously cannot hear the cries of the old world? One left behind, and one that only one man remembers…

https://half-life.wikia.com/wiki/Ivan_the_Space_Biker

Ivan, The Space Biker

Read full topic

item.title: New Half-Life 2: Episode 3 Concept Art?
item.dc:creator: Mr.Night
item.description:
My personal theory is that throughout the next Half-Life game, the G-Man will start developing a severe case of dyslexia due to an alien intercourse from when he was on vacation. When you finish the game, which should have progressed to a point where Freeman has finished with his mysterious assignment, the final cutscene will take about 3 hours for the G-Man to say something in the lines of “Well done, Missssster Freeman. blah-blah-blah” and then he’ll put you somewhere on holiday to live your days.

*Recording the 3 hours of dyslexic dialouge also explains why the game hasn’t been completed yet.

Read full topic

item.title: New Half-Life 2: Episode 3 Concept Art?
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
M-Man:

Personally I think that if Gordon gave up his life to save all of Earth or to finally stop Gman then it would be a noble and honorable way to die.

Fuck honor & nobility. Sacrificing your own life is for people too stupid to find an alternative. Even then there are few things worth sacrificing your own life for.

M-Man:

Someone sacrificing their life doesn’t have to be a sad ending.

No, it’s just a very limiting one. Most people who are in favor of killing of Gordon want to just for the sake of having a sequel with someone else as the main character. And of course to some people that implies they could make a whole bunch of other changes, like making the main character speak, making it Adrian Shepard, adding full-body awareness, etc.

Read full topic

item.description:
Gordon is too fucking badass to die. As long as the Gman is somehow besides Gordon there’s no way he could die. But what ever. Valve is probably baking an epic story behind this all.

item.title: New Half-Life 2: Episode 3 Concept Art?
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
xalener:

I think it’s really funny though how people expect concept art to be under or overwhelming. It’s not even supposed to whelm at all.

But when you hear about new concept art & you get 5 variants of some meaningless space-squiggles, it’s pretty disappointing.

Usually some info can be taken from concept art. Be it monster designs, weapons, settings, etc. The only piece of information learned from this is xen might be back & that Alyx might wear Eli’s old vest. Everything else is pretty much old news.

Read full topic

item.title: New Half-Life 2: Episode 3 Concept Art?
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
xalener:

I think it’s really funny though how people expect concept art to be under or overwhelming. It’s not even supposed to whelm at all.

It’s largely for developers to help plan the art style of the game. That doesn’t stop us from being over or underwhelmed.

Read full topic
